text.0: winner of thousands kindled thou shinest a god with gods today.
text.2: child of thyself the sacrifice is for the righteous blent with meath.
text.4: invoked and worthy of our praise bring gods whose due is sacrifice.
text.6: to seat a thousand heroes they eastward have strewn the grass with might.
text.8: the sovran allimperial doors wide good many and manifold.
text.9: have poured their streams of holy oil.
text.10: with gay adornment fair to see in glorious beauty shine they forth.
text.11: let night and morning rest them here.
text.12: let these two sages first of all heralds divine and eloquent.
text.14: you i address sarasvatī and bhāratī and iḷā all.
text.15: urge ye us on to glorious fame.
text.16: tvaṣṭar the lord hath made all forms and all the cattle of the field.
text.17: cause them to multiply for us.
text.18: send to the gods vanaspati thyself the sacrificial draught.
text.19: let agni make the oblations sweet.
text.20: agni preceder of the gods is honoured with the sacred song.
text.21: he glows at offerings blest with hail.
